episodeTitle: An Intense Battle! Caesar Exercises His True Power!
episodeTitleJapanese: 大激戦 シーザー真の能力発動！
episodeTitleRomanized: Dai-Gekisen - Shīzā Shin no Nōryoku Hatsudō!
description: Luffy battles Caesar Clown, who demonstrates his deadly gas-based abilities. Meanwhile, Law encounters Vergo and suffers a devastating defeat. Sanji rescues Kin'emon's torso, and the samurai reveals his Foxfire Style abilities to cut through fire.

events.title: Luffy vs Caesar Battle Begins
events.description: Luffy engages Caesar Clown in direct combat, using Armament Haki to grab the Logia user in his intangible gas form. The battle showcases Caesar's deadly gas-based abilities.
events.significance: First major confrontation between Luffy and Caesar, demonstrating both fighters' capabilities and establishing Caesar as a formidable opponent.

quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar defending his strength as a scientist and Devil Fruit user

events.title: Luffy's Poison Immunity Revealed
events.description: Luffy reveals that poison doesn't work well on him anymore, having developed immunity during his ordeal with Magellan in Impel Down. Caesar's poisonous gas attacks prove ineffective.
events.significance: Callback to Luffy's Impel Down experience and demonstrates character growth through past hardships. This immunity becomes crucial in fighting Caesar.

quotes.text: Poisons don't work well on me anymore!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Explaining his immunity developed from Magellan's poison

events.title: Caesar Uses Gas Robe Attack
events.description: Caesar Clown demonstrates his Gas Robe technique, generating clouds of poisonous gas and sending them towards enemies. Despite the attack's lethality, it proves ineffective against Luffy's poison immunity.
events.significance: First showcase of Caesar's signature gas-manipulation combat technique.

events.title: Caesar's Gastanet Explosion
events.description: Caesar fills a pair of castanets with unstable gas and slams them together, creating a massive explosion. He orders Smiley pieces to attach to Luffy, causing a blinding explosion.
events.significance: Demonstrates Caesar's ability to weaponize gas in creative ways, combining sound with explosive chemical reactions.

events.title: Luffy Collapses - Caesar's Hidden Ability
events.description: After appearing to gain the upper hand, Luffy spontaneously collapses without warning. Caesar reveals he has lethal abilities beyond his visible gas attacks, shocking observers who thought Luffy was winning.
events.significance: Major turning point in the battle showing Caesar is more dangerous than expected. Demonstrates that even with poison immunity, Luffy is vulnerable to Caesar's oxygen manipulation.

quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: As Luffy falls, Caesar reveals his true power

events.title: Caesar Defeats Multiple Opponents
events.description: Caesar Clown systematically defeats five major characters—Luffy, Robin, Franky, Smoker, and Tashigi—without physically touching them, using his gas powers to incapacitate them all. He orders them restrained with seastone.
events.significance: Establishes Caesar as a genuinely formidable threat capable of defeating multiple powerful fighters simultaneously. Shows the versatility and lethality of the Gasu Gasu no Mi.

events.title: Vergo Appears Before Law
events.description: Trafalgar Law encounters a mysterious figure in the laboratory who he recognizes. The figure reveals himself as Vergo, greeting Law familiarly while noting how much he has grown.
events.significance: Vergo's introduction (though shadowed) sets up a major antagonist with a past connection to Law. This encounter reveals the deeper conspiracy at Punk Hazard.

quotes.speaker: Vergo
quotes.context: Vergo's first words to Law, implying their shared history

events.title: Vergo's Connection to Law Revealed
events.description: Vergo reveals he knows Law personally from the past. He explains that he and Monet were sent as spies to Punk Hazard because of distrust of Caesar Clown, revealing a deeper conspiracy.
events.significance: Establishes that Vergo and Law have a shared history, and reveals the existence of a larger organization (Doflamingo's crew) manipulating events at Punk Hazard.

events.title: Law vs Vergo - Law's Defeat
events.description: Law desperately attempts to fight Vergo but is instantly defeated. Vergo's overwhelming strength and haki abilities prove too much for Law, who is already weakened.
events.significance: Demonstrates Vergo's immense power and establishes him as a serious threat. Shows Law's vulnerability when separated from his heart.

events.title: Smiley and Shinokuni Explained
events.description: Caesar explains that Smiley is capable of recreating the chemical explosion that devastated Punk Hazard four years ago. Zoro, Sanji, Brook, and Kin'emon see the massive slime creature approaching.
events.significance: Reveals the true danger of Caesar's experiment and the threat Smiley poses to everyone on the island. Sets up the race against time to escape Shinokuni.

events.title: Sanji's Heroic Dive for Kin'emon
events.description: Sanji dives into a poisonous, freezing lake to rescue Kin'emon's severed torso from being eaten by a shark. Despite the extreme cold and toxic conditions, he successfully retrieves the body using his Joue Shoot technique.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's selfless heroism and introduces his underwater mobility technique. Shows his growth since the timeskip.

events.title: Sanji's Blue Walk Debut
events.description: Sanji uses Blue Walk, a technique that allows him to run on water surfaces, to escape the poisonous lake as it becomes entirely toxic. This showcases his post-timeskip abilities.
events.significance: First appearance of Sanji's Blue Walk technique, demonstrating his underwater combat capabilities learned during the two-year training period.

events.title: Kin'emon Fully Revealed and Named
events.description: The samurai, now fully reconstructed with his torso reunited with his legs and head, formally introduces himself as Kin'emon of Foxfire from Kuri in Wano Country.
events.significance: First formal introduction of Kin'emon, one of the most important characters in the Wano storyline. Establishes his origin from Wano Country.

quotes.speaker: Kin'emon
quotes.context: Kin'emon's formal self-introduction after being fully reassembled

events.title: Foxfire Style Demonstrated
events.description: Kin'emon demonstrates his Foxfire Style swordsmanship, a technique that allows him to cut through fire itself. He uses it to destroy parts of Smiley's slime body, protecting the group.
events.significance: Introduction of the Foxfire Style, a legendary Wano sword technique. This ability becomes important for dealing with fire-based threats and later influences Zoro's techniques.

events.title: Zoro Offers to Help Kin'emon
events.description: Impressed by Kin'emon's Foxfire Style, Zoro expresses interest in the fighting technique and volunteers to help the samurai rescue his son from the laboratory.
events.significance: Establishes the bond between Zoro and Kin'emon, setting up their partnership. Shows Zoro's respect for skilled swordsmen and foreshadows his later interest in Wano techniques.

quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar asserting his power as Luffy falls

quotes.text: Poisons don't work well on me anymore!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Revealing his immunity from Impel Down

quotes.speaker: Vergo
quotes.context: Vergo's first words upon encountering Law

quotes.speaker: Kin'emon
quotes.context: Formal introduction after being fully reassembled

themes.description: The episode explores how appearances can be deceiving. Caesar, initially appearing as a weak scientist, proves formidable. Vergo's reveal as a spy shows the hidden threats.
themes.symbolism: Caesar's gas powers represent unseen dangers - threats that can't be easily detected or defended against.

themes.description: Luffy's poison immunity from Impel Down saves him temporarily. Law's past with Vergo comes back to haunt him. Past experiences define current capabilities.
themes.symbolism: The connection between characters' histories and their present struggles.

themes.description: Kin'emon's determination to save his son, Sanji's selfless rescue attempt, and Zoro's respect for skilled swordsmen all demonstrate the importance of honor.
themes.symbolism: The samurai culture represented by Kin'emon embodies traditional values of duty and honor.

characterSpotlights.development: Caesar is revealed to be far more dangerous than expected, systematically defeating multiple powerful fighters and demonstrating his Gasu Gasu no Mi abilities.
keyActions: Uses Gas Robe and Gastanet techniques
Defeats Luffy, Robin, Franky, Smoker, and Tashigi

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his growth through poison immunity but learns Caesar's abilities go beyond simple poisonous gas, leading to his defeat.
keyActions: Demonstrates poison immunity from Impel Down
quotes: Poisons don't work well on me anymore!

characterSpotlights.development: Kin'emon is fully revealed and introduces himself, demonstrating his Foxfire Style abilities and establishing himself as a capable warrior from Wano.
Vergo is introduced as a mysterious figure with connections to Law's past, immediately establishing himself as a powerful threat by defeating Law.
keyActions: Appears before Law in the laboratory

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji demonstrates his post-timeskip abilities and selfless nature through his dangerous rescue mission.
keyActions: Uses Blue Walk technique to escape

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended some of the battle sequences between Luffy and Caesar for dramatic effect.
Additional reactions from Robin and Franky watching the battle were added in the anime.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts chapters 671-672 of the manga, titled 'Gasu Gasu no Mi' and 'My Name is Kin'emon!!'
Caesar Clown's voice actor, Ryūsei Nakao, is famous for voicing Frieza in Dragon Ball Z, another arrogant and ruthless villain.
This episode marks the first full appearance and introduction of Vergo, who becomes a major antagonist in the Punk Hazard arc.
The episode achieved an 8.6% TV rating in Japan, ranking 6th in its timeslot.
Sanji's Blue Walk technique shown in this episode is an adaptation of the Fish-Man Karate principle, allowing him to treat water like a tangible surface.
